categories.name: Basic Road Signs
categories.desc: Learn about the essential road signs you need to recognize for safe driving.

quizzes.name: Road Sign Quiz 1
quizzes.desc: Test your knowledge on common road signs and their meanings.

chapters.name: Chapter One: Mandatory Signs
chapters.desc: Understand the signs that you must follow, such as stop signs and yield signs.

questions.question: What does the stop sign indicate?
questions.answer: You must come to a complete stop before proceeding.

questions.question: What does a yield sign mean?
questions.answer: You must give way to oncoming traffic.

chapters.name: Chapter Two: Warning Signs
chapters.desc: Learn about warning signs such as sharp curves, pedestrian crossings, and more.

questions.question: What does a sharp curve sign indicate?
questions.answer: It warns of a sharp turn ahead.

questions.question: What does a pedestrian crossing sign mean?
questions.answer: It warns of an upcoming pedestrian crossing.

quizzes.name: Road Sign Quiz 2
quizzes.desc: Advanced questions on road signs for experienced drivers.

chapters.name: Chapter One: Informational Signs
chapters.desc: Learn about signs that provide information such as distance and directions.

questions.question: What does a blue sign indicate?
questions.answer: A blue sign generally provides information or guidance.

questions.question: What does a distance marker indicate?
questions.answer: It shows how far you are from a specific destination.

categories.name: Traffic Rules and Regulations
categories.desc: Learn about the fundamental rules of the road, including speed limits and right-of-way.

quizzes.name: Traffic Rules Quiz 1
quizzes.desc: Test your knowledge of traffic rules and regulations.

chapters.name: Chapter One: Speed Limits
chapters.desc: Learn about speed limits and how they vary depending on the area.

questions.question: What is the speed limit in residential areas?
questions.answer: Typically, the speed limit is 30 km/h in residential areas.

questions.question: What is the speed limit on highways?
questions.answer: The speed limit on highways is usually 120 km/h.

chapters.name: Chapter Two: Right-of-Way
chapters.desc: Understand the rules for right-of-way at intersections and pedestrian crossings.

questions.question: Who has the right of way at an uncontrolled intersection?
questions.answer: The vehicle on the right has the right of way.

questions.question: What should you do if a pedestrian is crossing at a crosswalk?
questions.answer: Yield to the pedestrian.

quizzes.name: Traffic Rules Quiz 2
quizzes.desc: Advanced rules of the road for experienced drivers.

chapters.name: Chapter One: Overtaking and Passing
chapters.desc: Learn the rules for overtaking and passing safely on the road.

questions.question: When is it safe to overtake another vehicle?
questions.answer: Only when there is a clear view of the road ahead.

questions.question: Is it allowed to overtake on a curve?
questions.answer: No, overtaking on a curve is prohibited.

categories.name: Safe Driving Practices
categories.desc: Explore the best practices for staying safe while driving, including defensive driving.

quizzes.name: Safe Driving Quiz 1
quizzes.desc: Test your understanding of safe driving habits.

chapters.name: Chapter One: Defensive Driving
chapters.desc: Learn the techniques of defensive driving and how to anticipate potential hazards.

questions.question: What is defensive driving?
questions.answer: Defensive driving means being aware of potential hazards and taking action to avoid them.

questions.question: How can you avoid accidents in heavy traffic?
questions.answer: By maintaining a safe distance and being aware of other drivers.

chapters.name: Chapter Two: Speed and Control
chapters.desc: Learn how to maintain control of your vehicle at different speeds.

questions.question: What should you do if you start losing control of the vehicle?
questions.answer: Ease off the accelerator and steer in the direction of the skid.

questions.question: How does speeding affect your control?
questions.answer: Speeding reduces the time you have to react and increases stopping distance.

categories.name: Parking Techniques
categories.desc: Learn about parallel parking, reverse parking, and other parking techniques.

quizzes.name: Parking Quiz 1
quizzes.desc: Test your knowledge of different parking techniques.

chapters.name: Chapter One: Parallel Parking
chapters.desc: Learn how to master parallel parking.

questions.question: What is the first step in parallel parking?
questions.answer: Signal and stop next to the car in front of the parking space.

questions.question: How do you know if you are parked correctly?
questions.answer: Your car should be within a foot of the curb.

chapters.name: Chapter Two: Reverse Parking
chapters.desc: Understand how to safely park your car in reverse.

questions.question: What is the best way to position your car for reverse parking?
questions.answer: Align your car parallel to the parking spot and slowly reverse.

questions.question: When should you check your mirrors while reversing?
questions.answer: Check your mirrors constantly to ensure there are no obstacles.

categories.name: Hazard Perception
categories.desc: Understand how to identify and react to hazards on the road.

quizzes.name: Hazard Perception Quiz 1
quizzes.desc: Test your ability to recognize and react to potential hazards.

chapters.name: Chapter One: Identifying Hazards
chapters.desc: Learn how to identify potential hazards on the road.

questions.question: What should you do if you see a child playing near the road?
questions.answer: Slow down and be prepared to stop.

questions.question: How should you react to a vehicle that suddenly swerves?
questions.answer: Keep a safe distance and be ready to take evasive action.

chapters.name: Chapter Two: Road Conditions
chapters.desc: Understand how different road conditions can create hazards.

questions.question: How should you handle a pothole in the road?
questions.answer: Slow down and drive over it carefully, avoiding swerving.

questions.question: What should you do in foggy conditions?
questions.answer: Use low beam headlights and reduce your speed.
